me.aliceq.garbler

Class GarblerScript

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.aliceq.garbler.GarblerScript
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicSampleScript

    public abstract class GarblerScript
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class which is run by a GarblerLibrary used to specify how the program is run and how words are created. A GarblerScript relies on a GarblerLibrary to contain all of its relevant information.

    A GarblerScript features a GarblerTranslator at the output to filter output messages. By default, there is no filter but if one is desired it can be specified in the constructor.

    For creation the script offers three hook methods - preIterate, onIterate and postIterate. preIterate and postIterate are called once per word, before and after (respectively) any iterations are done. onIterate is called multiple times per word. The amount of based on the value of the iterations member at the time of iteration.

    The following members are available:
    buffer : String : A buffer of characters for word creation. During onIterate, any modifications to the word should be done here.
    iterations : int : The number of times to call onIterate. This should be set during preIterat.

      • next

        public final HeatMap<? extends java.lang.Comparable> next(java.lang.String key,
                                           java.lang.String context)
        Retrieves the next set of data from a stored analyzer using the current buffer data. This is identical to calling analyzer(key).next(context, buffer).
        Parameters:
        key - the key the analyzer is under
        context - context to pass to the analyzer, if any
        Returns:
        a HeatMap of data from the desired analyzer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid (non-existent) key is provided

      • next

        public final HeatMap<? extends java.lang.Comparable> next(java.lang.String key,
                                           java.lang.String context,
                                           java.lang.String wordPrefix)
        Retrieves the next set of data from a stored analyzer using the current buffer data. This is identical to calling analyzer(key).next(context, wordPrefix).
        Parameters:
        key - the key the analyzer is under
        context - context to pass to the analyzer, if any
        wordPrefix - the word context to use
        Returns:
        a HeatMap of data from the desired analyzer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid (non-existent) key is provided
